description: From Middle English venisoun, venesoun, from Anglo-Norman veneisun, venesoun, venesun (“meat of large game, particularly deer or boar; hunt”), from Latin vēnātiō, vēnātiōnem (“hunt; meat from a hunt”), formed on vēnātus, perfect participle of vēnor (“I hunt”). Doublet of venatio and venation.

examples: After shooting a deer, field dressing is the next step necessary for high quality venison.

entries.meaning: (South Africa) The meat of an antelope.
(obsolete) The meat of any wild animal that has been hunted rather than raised domestically.
